org.jtrim2.swing.component

Class AsyncRenderingComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • org.jtrim2.swing.component.Graphics2DComponent
            • org.jtrim2.swing.component.AsyncRenderingComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransformedImageDisplay

    public abstract class AsyncRenderingComponent
extends Graphics2DComponent
    Defines a base class for Swing components drawn in the background.

    This class relies on AsyncRenderer to do the background painting. This AsyncRenderer must be set before the component is actually rendered, preferably by passing it to the constructor. To provide input for the AsyncRenderer call one of the setRenderingArgs methods. It is also mandatory to call any of the setRenderingArgs before the component is actually displayed (the preferred way is to call setRenderingArgs from within the constructor of the implementation.

    This component also provides various methods to check the progress of the painting of this component. This might be used by implementations to do addition paintings in case the rendering process takes too much time.

    In case you want to set the rendering arguments (setRenderingArgs) lazily, you may do so in a pre-paint listener.

    The thread-safety property of this component is the same as with any other Swing components. That is, instances of this class can be accessed only from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread after made displayable.

    See Also:
    AsyncRenderer, setRenderingArgs, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsyncRenderingComponent

        public AsyncRenderingComponent()
        Initializes this AsyncRenderingComponent with a null AsyncRenderer, so the AsyncRenderer must be set later by calling the setAsyncRenderer method.

        Note: Don't forget to set the rendering arguments by calling one of the setRenderingArgs methods.

      • AsyncRenderingComponent

        public AsyncRenderingComponent(AsyncRendererFactory asyncRenderer)
        Initializes this AsyncRenderingComponent with a specified AsyncRenderer.

        Note: Don't forget to set the rendering arguments by calling one of the setRenderingArgs methods.

        Parameters:
        asyncRenderer - the AsyncRendererFactory to be used to render this component. This argument can be null, in which case, the AsyncRendererFactory must be set later by the setAsyncRenderer method.

    • Method Detail

      • addPrePaintListener

        public final ListenerRef addPrePaintListener(java.lang.Runnable listener)
        Adds a Runnable which is to be called in the paintComponent2D method prior actually painting. This listener can call the setRenderingArgs methods to set the rendering arguments before the painting takes place.

        This method may be called from any thread and is synchronization transparent.

        Parameters:
        listener - the Runnable whose run method is to be invoked by the paintComponent2D prior painting. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the reference which can be used to remove the currently added listener. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified listener is null.

      • getRenderingTime

        public final long getRenderingTime(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Returns the time elapsed since the last asynchronous painting has been drawn to this component. If no painting was done yet, this method returns the time since the creation of this component.

        Note that this method differs from getSignificantRenderingTime in that this method considers both significant and insignificant renderings.

        Parameters:
        unit - the unit of time in which the result is needed. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the time elapse since the last asynchronous painting has been drawn to this component
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified time unit argument is null.

      • getSignificantRenderingTime

        public final long getSignificantRenderingTime(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Returns the time elapsed since the last significant asynchronous painting has been drawn to this component. If no painting was done yet, this method returns the time since the creation of this component.

        Note that this method differs from getRenderingTime in that this method only considers rendering which were significant.

        Parameters:
        unit - the unit of time in which the result is needed. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the time elapse since the last significant asynchronous painting has been drawn to this component
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified time unit argument is null.

      • isRendering

        public boolean isRendering()
        Returns true if an synchronous rendering of this component is in progress.
        Returns:
        true if an synchronous rendering of this component is in progress, false otherwise

      • setAsyncRenderer

        public final void setAsyncRenderer(AsyncRendererFactory asyncRenderer)
        Sets the AsyncRenderer to use by this component to render asynchronously. The AsyncRenderer must be set before this component is made displayable.

        This method may only be called if the AsyncRenderer has not been specified at construction time and this method has not yet been called.

        Parameters:
        asyncRenderer - the AsyncRenderer used to render this component. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null

      • setRenderingArgs

        protected final void setRenderingArgs(ImageRenderer<?,?> componentRenderer)
        Sets the ImageRenderer which will be used to render the content of this component. Using this method assumes that no data is provided for the passed ImageRenderer, so its render method will not be called, every rendering must be done in the startRendering or in the finishRendering method.

        This method is equivalent to calling setRenderingArgs(null, componentRenderer, null.

        Note: Calling any of the setRenderingArgs methods will overwrite the previous setRenderingArgs method calls.

        Parameters:
        componentRenderer - the ImageRenderer which is used to render the content of this component. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified ImageRenderer is null
        See Also:
        setRenderingArgs(AsyncDataLink, ImageRenderer, PaintHook)

      • setRenderingArgs

        protected final <DataType> void setRenderingArgs(AsyncDataLink<? extends DataType> dataLink,
                                                 ImageRenderer<? super DataType,?> componentRenderer)
        Sets the ImageRenderer which will be used to render the content of this component with an AsyncDataLink which is used to provide input for the render method of the passed ImageRenderer. The render method will be called with the data received from the data link (possibly omitting some of the data but the last).

        This method is equivalent to calling setRenderingArgs(dataLink, componentRenderer, null.

        Note: Calling any of the setRenderingArgs methods will overwrite the previous setRenderingArgs method calls.

        Type Parameters:
        DataType - the type of the data provided by the passed AsyncDataLink
        Parameters:
        dataLink - the AsyncDataLink which is used to provide data for the render method of the ImageRenderer. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing a data link which immediately completes successfully without providing any data.
        componentRenderer - the ImageRenderer which is used to render the content of this component. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified ImageRenderer is null
        See Also:
        setRenderingArgs(AsyncDataLink, ImageRenderer, PaintHook)

      • setRenderingArgs

        protected final <DataType,ResultType> void setRenderingArgs(AsyncDataLink<? extends DataType> dataLink,
                                                            ImageRenderer<? super DataType,ResultType> componentRenderer,
                                                            AsyncRenderingComponent.PaintHook<ResultType> paintHook)
        Sets the ImageRenderer which will be used to render the content of this component with an AsyncDataLink which is used to provide input for the render method of the passed ImageRenderer; and an interface which can further define the rendering of this component. The render method will be called with the data received from the data link (possibly omitting some of the data but the last).

        The provided PaintHook is called before and after the rendering and so it can be used to do additional rendering on the AWT Event Dispatch Thread.

        This method is equivalent to calling setRenderingArgs(dataLink, componentRenderer, null.

        Note: Calling any of the setRenderingArgs methods will overwrite the previous setRenderingArgs method calls.

        Type Parameters:
        DataType - the type of the data provided by the passed AsyncDataLink
        ResultType - the type of the object returned by the specified ImageRenderer. This result is to be passed to the postPaintComponent method of the specified PaintHook object.
        Parameters:
        dataLink - the AsyncDataLink which is used to provide data for the render method of the ImageRenderer. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing a data link which immediately completes successfully without providing any data.
        componentRenderer - the ImageRenderer which is used to render the content of this component. This argument cannot be null.
        paintHook - the PaintHook object which is called before and after the rendering. This argument can be null if such callback is not required.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified ImageRenderer is null

      • renderAgain

        protected final void renderAgain()
        Causes the previously set ImageRenderer to be called again to render this component. Calling this method is equivalent to calling the setRenderingArgs method with the same arguments as done previously. Calling this method before calling any of the setRenderingArgs method has no effect.

      • paintDefault

        protected void paintDefault(RenderingState state,
                            java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Called to render this component when no rendering has been done by the previously set ImageRenderer. This method is called on the AWT Event Dispatch Thread and subclasses may override this method to provide a user defined implementation.

        The default implementation will simply fill the passed Graphics2D object with the currently set background color.

        Parameters:
        state - the state of the current asynchronous rendering, or null if there is no rendering in progress
        g - the Graphics2D to paint to render this component. This argument cannot be null. The graphics context is not need to be preserved by this method.

      • paintComponent2D

        protected final void paintComponent2D(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Renders this component. Subclasses cannot override this method, they can call one of the setRenderingArgs methods and override the paintDefault method to define how this component should be rendered.
        Specified by:
        paintComponent2D in class Graphics2DComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics2D to paint to. This argument cannot be null.
